message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.SI 

This paper deals with the problem of defining equivalence among directed graphs based on the distributions they can generate. This is a problem that is relevant to several areas of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), information theory (cs.IT), data structures (cs.DS), and social and information networks (cs.SI). Given that the paper proposes a score-based method for learning the structure from observational data, it is likely to be of interest to researchers in the machine learning community (cs.LG) who are interested in graphical models and causal inference. The paper's focus on characterizing distribution equivalence is also relevant to researchers in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) who are interested in reasoning under uncertainty and probabilistic graphical models. Finally, the paper's contributions to the theory of directed graphs and the generation of distributions may be of interest to researchers in information theory (cs.IT), data structures (cs.DS), and social and information networks (cs.SI).
